column2: Ready for your next coding assignment?
Of course!
Launch Lightspeed.
I'd like you to add the enemies for Level 7. But this time we should have *two* different kinds of enemies at once.
You should go to the code view as usual.

Click on the Spawn tab and look for the `spawnEnemy()` function as usual.

Whenever it's time to spawn an enemy make sure to return two kinds of enemies: *asteroid*, *spinner*, or *squid*.
How do you pick one random number? That's right: the `random()` function.
And how do use it to pick one of two things? We could do `random(1,2)`.
And all of that in an `if` statement to pick one enemy or the other.
All of that after `if (ticksSinceSpawn > 40) {...}` of course.
Make sure you go back and test your code in the game!
Let's test the level now.
Let's see if we get *two* types of enemies.
Hmmm. No enemies at all! Are you sure you spawned some? Go back and check.
We're missing some enemy types. Go back and make sure to spawn at least *two* types.
That solution is correct. Now beat the level.

Well done. Perhaps you could use a 
*hush gasket*.

I think you'll find this quite useful in your studies. It's amazing how many things call for a hush gasket. 

You're always making things so I figured you could use one!
Okay. Just check back later when you're ready to do some more work on Lightspeed!
